page.title: 20MODERN ART AT BLAYDON COMP.
page.content: A group of pupils has been working on a project intended to develop their awareness of the problems associated with the built environment. From this they developed their own ideas as to how a neglected site within the school could be improved with a sculpture incorporating seating and landscaping. The sculpture was based on the familiar symbol of the mining industry, the pit head wheel. The final sculpture is a relief panel inwhich the dynamism of the wheel has been captured by the interrelation of the three sets of spokes. The sculpture was initially constructed from wood and scrap, and was strengthened and weatherproofed by layers of fibre glass prior to being bolted to he support wall.
